title: French President Macron promises Ukraine Mirage aircraft to fend off Russian attacks
summary: During his TV interview on Thursday, Macron also confirmed that Moscow arrested a Frenchman working for a Swiss NGO, and warned that the EU could be 'blocked' by the far right, ahead in the polls for the upcoming European elections.

title: 2024 European elections: Who is running in France?
summary: France will vote on June 9 to elect 81 members of the European Parliament, as the 27 member states of the European Union renew the legislature's 720 seats.

title: Russia 'maps weak spots and dividing lines in target countries'
summary: Incidents targeting Finland, Scandinavia, and the three Baltic countries have multiplied. Experts have taken inventory of them and recommend coordinated action for deterrence.

title: Russia holds Frenchman accused of gathering military information
summary: Laurent Vinatier, who works for a Geneva-based conflict mediation NGO, is also accused of failing to register as a 'foreign agent.' 'We will follow this closely and he will receive all consular protection,' French President Macron said Thursday evening.

title: French Open 2024: Italy's Paolini to play Swiatek in her first Grand Slam final
summary: Jasmine Paolini is through to her first Grand Slam final at the age of 28 after ending the run of 17-year-old Russian sensation Mirra Andreeva.

title: 'Under Paris:' The new 'Jaws' in freshwater
summary: The new Netflix feature movie turns a shark attack into a moment of truth for the capital's mayor, on the eve of a triathlon.

title: D-Day: 80th anniversary in pictures
summary: Hundreds of surviving WWII veterans were joined by world leaders on the Normandy beaches on Thursday for the 80th anniversary of the D-Day landings.

title: Russian connections of several far-right MEPs become clearer
summary: Counter-espionage services are investigating three news websites and their links with French and other European elected representatives.

title: Western US baking in extreme early-summer heatwave
summary: Temperatures are reaching 111 degrees Fahrenheit (44 degrees Celsius) in Las Vegas, while in the Death Valley desert, it was expected to shoot past 120F. Experts warn the unseasonably scorching temperatures could signal the start of a brutal summer.

title: 2024 European elections: When do the 27 member states vote?
summary: The Netherlands, which never votes on Sundays, will open the polls on Thursday. In some countries, elections are held over two days, and in Italy, polling stations close at 11 pm on Sunday.

title: The crazy story of the lost Caravaggio, now on display at the Prado
summary: The painting by the Italian artist attracted the attention of collectors worldwide after being discovered in an auction catalogue listed for €1,500.

title: Trump ally Steve Bannon must surrender to prison by July 1
summary: He must serve his four-month sentence for defying a subpoena from the House committee that investigated the US Capitol insurrection, a federal judge ruled Thursday.

title: 'Climate chaos': Planet breaks temperature records for twelfth month in a row
summary: It is now 80% likely that the global average annual temperature will temporarily exceed the 1.5°C warming threshold for at least one of the next five years. UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has called for action.

title: Israel transfers Gazan prisoners from detention center where army is accused of torture
summary: The Israeli army will transfer hundreds of prisoners out of the Sde Teiman military-run detention center after the deaths of 36 detainees there. An Israeli healthworker who was onsite at the center's field hospital told Le Monde he witnessed 'human rights violations.'

title: Who's rich in France? The Inequality Observatory revives the debate
summary: In its latest study, the French organization sets the bar for being rich at an after-tax salary of €3,860 for a single person, and observes that, while there are fewer and fewer such people in France, the rich are getting richer.

title: Starliner at the space station after thruster trouble
summary: Boeing plans to keep the capsule at the ISS for at least eight days before guiding it to a landing in the western US.

title: ECB cuts key rate by quarter point, but raises inflation forecast
summary: The European Central Bank lowered its key deposit rate to 3.75%, in its first interest rate cut since 2019.

title: Putin threatens to supply long-range missiles to other countries to strike the West
summary: During a lengthy press conference, the Russian president suggested that Moscow would supply weapons to other countries, in an attempt to influence the current major talks among Western countries.
